pullRequest.title: 6761 payara installer update
pullRequest.bodyText:
What this PR does / why we need it:
These changes make the new Python3 installer work with Payara. (v.5.201+ required)
Which issue(s) this PR closes:
Closes #6761
Special notes for your reviewer:
Suggestions on how to test this:
Does this PR introduce a user interface change?:
Is there a release notes update needed for this change?:
Additional documentation:

commit.message:
Verify that this is a valid Payara installation, and a supported version, from python.
(ref. #6761)
Few more installer tweaks from yesterday. #6761

nodes.bodyText: I'm just noting the conversation about this change at #6812 (comment)
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -229,12 +230,12 @@
    print("Checking for required components...")
    # 1a. check to see if warfile is available
    warfile = "dataverse.war"
-   warfileVersion = None
+   warfileVersion = ""
    if not os.path.isfile(warfile):
       # get dataverse version from pom.xml
       tree = ET.ElementTree(file='../../pom.xml')
       for elem in tree.iter("*"):
-         if elem.tag == '{http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0}version':
+         if elem.tag == '{https://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0}version':

nodes.bodyText:
This has been fine under Glassfish4 and is fine under Payara5, but installation-main sez

The installer places files called jhove.conf and jhoveConfig.xsd into the directory /usr/local/glassfish4/glassfish/domains/domain1/config by default and makes adjustments to the jhove.conf file based on the directory into which you chose to install Glassfish.

We might a) update that to payara5 and b) I don't see logic in the script to adjust the path in jhove.conf; we might note in the docs that the file would need to be edited?

I almost touched doc/sphinx-guides/source/_static/util/default.config as part of the doc issue I'm working on but stopped after seeing the edit above. There are many copies of default.config (screenshot below) and we should figure out where/when to update them.

commit.message: fixed the Makefile for packaging the installer bundle (#6761)

prevent "Symbol not found" errors on Mac #6761

See https://stackoverflow.com/a/58443768/19464
added the jsf patch to the payara installer (#6761)

added the code to adjust the location of the schema file in the jhove.conf file,
if payara is installed somewhere other than /usr/local/payara5.  (#6761)

Merge pull request #6825 from IQSS/6761-psycopg2

prevent "Symbol not found" errors on Mac #6761

changed the python readme and requirements.txt to use psycopg2-binary as the
recommended installation package. (#6761)
got the old installer to work with payara; just in case. (#6761)
added the jsf patch to the old installer as well. #6761
(and of course we need to go back to expecting "http:" in the pom.xml schema...) #6761

 The extra module psycopg2 (PostgreSQL client) is required. The
-installer has been tested with psycopg2 version 2.8.4.
+installer has been tested with psycopg2 version 2.8.4. 
 
-Install the module with 
+We recommend that you try installing the "binary", pre-built version of the package:
 
-pip install psycopg2 
+pip install psycopg2-binary
 
-(or "pip3 install psycopg2" if you intend to use python3 and it's
+(or "pip3 install psycopg2-binary" if you intend to use python3 and it's
 installed separately on your system)
 
-In order to build the module, pip will need to execute pg_config,
-PostgreSQL configuration utility. Make sure it is in your PATH. If you
-have multiple versions of PostgresQL installed, make sure the version
-that you will be using with Dataverse is the first on your PATH. For
-example,
+If for whatever reason the binary psycopg2 package doesn't run
+properly on your system, you can try the more complex process of
+making pip build it from sources:
+
+pip3 install psycopg2
+
+This will require compilers to be properly installed on your system.
+(On MacOS, you'll need XCode installed).

commit.message: script name change in the makefile
